name: schlep
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to move yourself or an object with effort and difficulty: Do I really have to schlep all that junk down to the cellar?
Thesaurus: synonyms, antonyms, and examples
to move someone or something from one place to anothercarryThese rail cars carry coal.haulHe grew up hauling coal out of the mines six days a week.cartThe suspects were carted away by police.lugI have to lug the shopping in from the car by myself!humpHe humped the mattress up to his third-floor flat by himself.schlepI need to schlep the trash to the curb.

something that takes a lot of effort to do: It's a real schlep getting it all home.

schlep verb
(CARRY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ T ] infml -pp- (also schlepp); (shlep) to carry an object with effort: [ I ] We schlepped our suitcases into the airport.
schlep verb
(GO)
[ I ] to go or move around with effort: I’ve been schlepping all over town looking for just the right present.
